responses: 0: No. Legislation is routinely passed without the approval of the lower (or unicameral)
1: Yes, usually. Legislation is usually passed with the approval of the lower (or unicameral)
chamber of the legislature, but occasionally the legislature is by-passed.
2: Yes, always. Legislation of any consequence is always approved by the lower (or unicameral)
citation: Pemstein et al. (2018, V-Dem Working Paper Series 2018:21); V-Dem Codebook (see suggested citation at the top of this document).
question: In practice, is the approval of the lower (or unicameral) chamber of the legislature required to pass legislation?
name: v2lglegplo, *_osp, *_ord
